text: The Persian fallow deer (Dama dama mesopotamica) (gavazn-i zard in Persian) (Yah-mur in modern Hebrew) is a rare ruminant mammal belonging to the family Cervidae. Its taxonomic status is disputed, with some maintaining it as a subspecies of the fallow deer, while others treat it as a separate species, Dama mesopotamica. Database entry includes a brief justification of why this species is of endangered. == References == == Other websites == * Persian fallow deer at Animal Info Category:Mammals of Asia Category:Deer Category:Endangered species Category:IUCN Red List endangered species
title: Persian fallow deer
